@graph.name: Monster Cookies - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Best monster cookies recipe! Crispy on the outside & soft and chewy on the inside! They’re loaded with peanut butter, chocolate chips & M&Ms!

@graph.name: Can you use instant oatmeal in Monster Cookies?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, quick-cooking oatmeal is a fine substitution for old-fashioned oatmeal.

@graph.name: Can you use natural peanut butter in cookies?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, but be aware that the cookies may spread more and be more on the crispy side than the soft side. Also, many natural peanut butters are unsalted, so you may need to increase the amount of salt int he recipe by 1/4 tsp.

@graph.name: How do you keep peanut butter cookies from crumbling?

acceptedAnswer.text: First, make sure you do not over-bake or over-mix them. Second, be sure to store them in an airtight container.
The most common reason for dry cookies is over-baking. Check your oven's temperature and bake for a shorter amount of time.

@graph.name: Monster Cookies Recipe
@graph.description: The best monster cookies recipe! These monster cookies are crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside, plus they’re loaded with peanut butter, chocolate chips & M&Ms!

video.name: Monster Cookies Recipe
video.description: The best monster cookies recipe! These monster cookies are crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside, plus they’re loaded with peanut butter, chocolate chips & M&Ms!

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, sea salt, and cinnamon. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, sea salt, and cinnamon. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat together butter, peanut butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
recipeInstructions.name: In the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat together butter, peanut butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.

recipeInstructions.text: Add vanilla and egg and beat until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add vanilla and egg and beat until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the dry ingredient mixture and beat until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the dry ingredient mixture and beat until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add oatmeal and beat until evenly distributed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add oatmeal and beat until evenly distributed.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chocolate chips and M&Ms and stir until evenly distributed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chocolate chips and M&Ms and stir until evenly distributed.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover dough with plastic wrap, or transfer to an airtight container with a lid and chill for at least 1 hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover dough with plastic wrap, or transfer to an airtight container with a lid and chill for at least 1 hour.

recipeInstructions.text: After 1 hour, preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: After 1 hour, preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a small cookie scoop to portion dough into 1 ½ TBS portions, roll into balls and place evenly spaced on the prepared baking sheet. Gently press the tops down slightly. (NOTE: Dough will be slightly tacky, but should still roll easily into balls).
recipeInstructions.name: Use a small cookie scoop to portion dough into 1 ½ TBS portions, roll into balls and place evenly spaced on the prepared baking sheet. Gently press the tops down slightly. (NOTE: Dough will be slightly tacky, but should still roll easily into balls).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for 10-11 minutes, or until cookies are just barely set.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the preheated oven for 10-11 minutes, or until cookies are just barely set.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool on the baking pan for 5-10 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool on the baking pan for 5-10 minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
